MODULE.name: Navbar
MODULE.HELP_OVERVIEW: he NavBar API supports a native navigation bar for the iPhone.
MODULE.MORE_HELP: ## Enabling the API This API is part of the `coreapi` extension that is included automatically. :::ruby extensions: ["coreapi"]

METHOD.name: create
METHOD.DESC: Removes the current NavBar and replaces it with this one.

PARAM.name: action
PARAM.DESC: URL to call when button is pressed.It may be path to Ruby controller action; i.e. '/app/Account' would load the Account index action. For ruby callback use 'callback:/app/Account' Or javascript method to call: 'javascript: methodOnButton();'.

METHOD.name: remove
METHOD.DESC: Removes the current navigation bar. Does nothing if there is no active navigation bar.

METHOD.name: started
METHOD.DESC: Return true is navbar is started (used only for automatic tests!)
